climbs.name: Snow White and the Seven Dwarves
climbs.fa: FA (trad) by Michael Steele and John Steele as Pitch1 of "Heights of Madness."

content.description: Also Known just as "Dwarves" - Start as per Snow white, but at the ledge after the first bolt, head left to a runout second bolt. Follow a line of bolts up to the chain anchor shared with Sleeping Beauty.
content.location: A bolted face. Just left of Sleeping Beauty, 100 feet left of the Wine Couloir, after a cairn with some old flags on it.

content.description: Climb the low angle rock passing 1 bolt to a grassy ledge.  Continue on good holds past 2 bolts to the crux at bolt #3 find the incut pinch and get high feet and make another move on thin holds to reach the low angled terrain with good holds.  Plug some gear (I used a .5 camalot) and continue up to the small roof with a bolt (kinda runout).  Pull past the roof on the left and past 1 more bolt ending at the chains.
content.protection: 5 bolts I felt only a .5 camalot was the only trad gear required, but moving up to the roof bolt was a little runout on easy terrain so additional pro may be warranted.
content.location: bolted face about 20 feet from the scramble to Heroine Hypnosis.

content.description:
Start on the left end of the High Wall on the arete, 30 feet left of Osprey and 20 feet right of "Dragon's Lair".  On the left end of the low roof where a rock bench can be found.  

  P1: Climb straight up the arete on clean rock with good gear, passing a large ominous looking block on the right (avoid).  Belay at a 2 bolt anchor (5.8G) 

  P2: Continue straight up from the belay to the largest part of the overhang.  Pull the hang on good gear, 10 feet left of where "Pain" pulls the hang.  Continue up on clean rock above until you reach a very thin seam (10 feet left of the upper crack on "Pain Builds Character"). Unlock the sequence and finish at a 2 bolt anchor.  (5.10G) 

  V1. It's possible to diagonal up and left from the belay, around the arete and climb the second pitch of "Dragon's", bringing the grade down to 5.6G 

  P3: A third pitch is possible but very loose, scary and not for the faint of heart.  Most will rap after the second pitch. 

  2 single rope raps or 1 double rope rap will put you back on the ground.

Same start as Osprey.  At 35', trend left, staying on the arete and face, staying 10-20 feet away from the crack system that makes up Osprey.  Pass a small overhang.  At a steep headwall, climb the obvious, right slanting crack to a stance below the intimidating final roof system.  For the full 5.10 value, finish on the roofs above, toping out by pulling on clumps of grass to reach rap station, shared with Osprey

Pitch 1: Climb up easy terrain to a small indent with a roof. Pass the roof on the left (5.6) and belay on the flat ledge above (80-90 feet). 

  Pitch 2: Follow the obvious line straight up, passing three small roofs on the way. Use long slings to avoid rope drag as this pitch is 120 feet. Rope management is critical here. There is a roof with a crack that is known to jam ropes for both leader and follower. At the top of the climb there is a huge roof that you skirt underneath to the left and finish on a dirty, loose ledge with a good tree (Same as Heroine Hypnosis).
content.protection:
Good protection with some of the best rock at DWG. It's solid all the way until the final dirty ledge where there is some small loose stuff. Use long slings to avoid rope drag on the roofs. 

  Has good bolts and rings at the top.
content.location:
Hike the Blue Trail and arrive at the Practice Face. Turn left and follow the cliff for about 100-150 yards. The climbs Osprey and Heroine Hypnosis are just after the point where you make a 4th class scramble up to a high point along the path. Osprey is on the left, HH is on the right. 

  Two 60M ropes will take you to the bottom.

content.description:
Pitch 1: Pass a low roof on the left and climb a flake 45 feet to belay below a small roof to the left of, and slightly higher than, the long, larger rook of Blue Sparks from Hell (5.10). 

  Pitch 2: Move left around this small overhang, then right around the ends of tow other roofs to a large corner system with a large, grassy ledge and rappel rings. 

  Pitch 3: Climb the corner (actually the right face of the large corner). Your see a tree and a grungy corner above you. Don't go here. Weave to the left and finish moving left under the large roof that forms the finale of Osprey. Use the same belay tree as Osprey.
content.protection: Rap station on p2. No fixed gear but easy to protect.
content.location:
Hike the Blue Trail from Cold Air Cave and arrive at the Practice Face. Turn left and follow the cliff for about 100-150 yards. The climbs Osprey and Heroine Hypnosis are just after the point where you make a 4th class scramble up to a high point along the path.  

  Osprey is on the left, HH is on the right.

content.description:
Start with your feet jammed in the crack, hands matched out right. Traverse to the pointed outside corner and make a big reach off a thin heel to a good hold with a small rhodo growing in it. Make a hard mantle to get your feet on the face, and top out on good holds. 

  A good V1 goes through the small overhang 25ft right of this problem on the 20' face.
content.protection: pad or backpack stuffed with jackets
content.location: Directly below Osprey. Instead of following the trail up along the face to start Osprey and Heroine, go left below the small buttress.

content.description: This wall offers adventurous three pitch routes ranging from 5.5 to 5.11. It's divided into three sections.
